org.universAAL.ri.gateway.utils

Class CallSynchronizer<ID,INPUT,OUTPUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.universAAL.ri.gateway.utils.CallSynchronizer<ID,INPUT,OUTPUT>

  • public abstract class CallSynchronizer<ID,INPUT,OUTPUT>
extends Object
    A Helper class that enables to perform calls and wait for the asynchronous response.
    Author:
    amedrano

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CallSynchronizer()
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abortCall(ID id)
      Abort the call with the given ID.
      protected abstract void operate(ID callerID, INPUT input)
      This method operates the call, it performs the adequate operations to ensure there will be a response calling on another thread.
      OUTPUT performCall(ID callerID, INPUT input)
      This method is the main method to syncronize the caller thread.
      void performResponse(ID id, OUTPUT output)
      When a response for a call is found, this method should be used to notify the Caller Thread waiting for it.
      void purge()
      When there will be no more responses this method aborts all calls,

    • Constructor Detail

      • CallSynchronizer

        public CallSynchronizer()
        Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • performCall

        public OUTPUT performCall(ID callerID,
                          INPUT input)
                   throws InterruptedException
        This method is the main method to syncronize the caller thread. The caller Thread will be stoped until another thread calls CallSynchronizer#performResponse(ID, Object).
        Parameters:
        callerID - the Id to identify the call.
        input - The input needed to perform the call.
        Returns:
        the call response.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - when the call was aborted by other thread.
        See Also:
        CallSynchronizer#performResponse(ID, Object)

      • operate

        protected abstract void operate(ID callerID,
                                INPUT input)
        This method operates the call, it performs the adequate operations to ensure there will be a response calling on another thread.
        Parameters:
        callerID - the call identifier
        input - the input needed for the call

      • performResponse

        public void performResponse(ID id,
                            OUTPUT output)
        When a response for a call is found, this method should be used to notify the Caller Thread waiting for it.
        Parameters:
        id -
        output -

      • abortCall

        public void abortCall(ID id)
        Abort the call with the given ID. it unblocks the call and the performCall(Object, Object) will throw a InterruptedException.
        Parameters:
        id -

      • purge

        public void purge()
        When there will be no more responses this method aborts all calls,
